etymology.description: semantic: 舌 ‘tongue’ + 甘 ‘sweet’; rearrangement of 甛.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the ideas of a tongue and sweetness, evoking the tongue sensing a sweet taste. The earlier form 甛 was visually rearranged into the modern layout 甜.

examples.chinese: 这茶很甜，不需要加糖(這茶很甜，不需要加糖)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè chá hěn tián, bù xūyào jiā táng.
examples.english: This tea is sweet; no sugar is needed.

examples.chinese: 孩子的笑容很甜，让人感到温暖(孩子的笑容很甜，讓人感到溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi de xiàoróng hěn tián, ràng rén gǎndào wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: The child’s smile is sweet and makes people feel warm.

examples.chinese: 这个蛋糕太甜了，我更喜欢清淡一点的口味(這個蛋糕太甜了，我更喜歡清淡一點的口味)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège dàngāo tài tián le, wǒ gèng xǐhuan qīngdàn yìdiǎn de kǒuwèi.
examples.english: This cake is too sweet; I prefer a lighter flavor.
